title: Abstract State Machines
desc: A formal method for specifying and verifying algorithms.  Tools, meetings, researchers in the area.

title: ACM SIGACT
desc: Special Interest Group on Algorithms and Computation Theory, the ACM special interest group for Theoretical Computer Science.  Site has membership information, meetings, reports and a newsletter for members.

title: Algorithm Design Paradigms
desc: A course by Paul Dunne at the University of Liverpool.  Slides and notes in HTML and PS.

title: Algorithms Archive
desc: A collection including searching, sorting, tracking, mathematics and cellular automata.  In English and Italian.

title: Algorithms Courses
desc: Links to courses in algorithms maintained at various university computer science departments.

title: Algorithms in the Real World
desc: Notes for a course at Carnegie Mellon University.

title: Analysis Of Algorithms
desc: An initiative of attendees of the 1997 Dagstuhl seminar, these pages provide research papers, a bulletin board, and links to researchers and other resources in the field.  The focus is on average case and probabilistic analysis.

title: Combinatorial Algorithms
desc: Course material, syllabus and notes for a course by Roger Whitney at SDSU.

title: Combinatorial Algorithms
desc: Lecture notes of a course at San Diego State University.

title: Computer Programming Algorithms Directory
desc: Resources that describe computer programming algorithms.

title: Data Structures
desc: Lecture notes by Steven Skiena.

title: Design and Analysis of Computer Algorithms
desc: Lecture notes; applets and code in C, C++, and Java; links regarding books, journals, computability, quantum computing, societies and organizations.

title: Dictionary of Algorithms, Data Structures, and Problems
desc: A dictionary of algorithms, algorithmic techniques, data structures, and archetypical problems, with related definitions.  Many entries have links to  implementations, tutorials, and  bibliographical references.

title: On the Road to Algorithms
desc: Information on algorithms such as Bubble Sort and Random Number Generation, using HTML, Java and Perl.  Collected by Lam Ka Chun (Raymond).

title: Dreamcast @ MobyGames
desc: Database of documentation for video games and companies.

title: Dreamcast Heaven And Hell
desc: General site featuring screen shots, news, music, and links.

title: Dreamcast Links
desc: Offers reviews for the games.

title: Dreamcast Programming
desc: Hardware, software, and links.

title: Dreamcast Scene
desc: Offers reviews, articles, and information.

title: Compact Guide to Sorting and Searching
desc: Algorithms and data structures. Source code in C and VB is included.  Demonstration applets in Java.

title: Exact String Matching Algorithms
desc: Common pattern search approaches with C implementations.

title: Fast Median Search
desc: Overview of algorithms to find the median in a list of values; implementations and links are also provided.

title: Fast Multi-Pattern Search
desc: A fast algorithm for multi-pattern searching by Sun Wu

title: Fibonacci Search in C
desc: Fibonacci search and C sample code.

title: FlashSort
desc: Sorting by in place permutation with time complexity O(n) using an auxiliary vector.  Papers, animations and implementations.

title: Fuzzy Search
desc: Approximate search resources on ITman homepage.

title: GNU libavl
desc: Details of this collection of binary search tree and balanced tree library routines by Ben Pfaff.  Etext in HTML/PDF/PS and source distribution.

title: Grover's Quantum Search Algorithm and Mixed States
desc: Research thesis done under the supervision of Prof. Eli Biham.

title: Nearest Neighbors and Similarity Search
desc: Slides of tutorial, bibliography, list of related researchers, open problems in similarity search area.

title: Postman's Sort
desc: A linear time general purpose sorting algorithm.  Included is a description of the algorithm and downloadable executables for Windows computers.

title: Quantum Random Walk Search
desc: Search algorithm based on the quantum random walk architecture that provides a speed-up similar   to other quantum search algorithms.

title: Robsort GNU implementation
desc: An O(n!) algorithm with downloads for Win98 and Unix platforms.

title: RumAVL
desc: An ANSI C implementation of threaded AVL trees.

title: Search Algorithm
desc: From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia. Classification, summaries of the popular searching algorithms, links.

title: 3D Object Intersection
desc: A grid of intersection routines for various popular objects, pointing to resources in books and on the web.

title: Andrew's Autostereogram Pages
desc: A detailed development of a stereogram-generation algorithm is presented, complete with a ready-to-run Windows program to download and experiment with.

title: Andrija Radovic´'s Algorithms
desc: Several unique algorithms for fast and optimal computations with integer numbers and graphics suitable for hardware implementation: dividing, square rooting, line drawing, ellipse drawing, Haiku plot routine.

title: Caffeine Owl
desc: Introduction to cubic and quadratic Bezier curves.

title: Chris Bregler's home page
desc: Research and recent papers on video-based capture of human movements. The main applications are feature animation, video games, and analyzing Movement Disorder

title: OOPWeb Algorithms Directory
desc: Algorithms lecture notes, courses, tutorials, references, guides and online books.

title: Pattern Matching Pointers
desc: A collection of links for and to researchers in the subject.

title: Priority Queues
desc: Electronic bibliography on priority queues (heaps). Links to downloadable reports, researchers' home pages, and software.

title: Problems in Analysis of Algorithms
desc: A list of open problems with updates and solutions.

title: Resources for the Analysis of Algorithms
desc: Links to papers, conferences and other sites, maintained by Helmut Prodinger.

title: Softpanorama Algorithms and Data Structures
desc: A compilation of links and background information.

title: Stony Brook Algorithm Repository
desc: This is a collection of implementations for 75 fundamental algorithms problems, including data structures, numerical and combinatorial algorithms, graph algorithms, and computational geometry. Implementations are available in C++, Java, Fortran, and other languages.

title: Tree Automata Techniques and Applications
desc: An evolving web text in PostScript and PDF, with related software.

title: Web Data Structures and Algorithms
desc: Lecture notes and links for a course by Godfried Toussaint.

title: 1StopPopup's JavaScript Popup Creator
desc: Makes JavaScript popup window code.

title: Arun's Javascript Utilities
desc: Collection of ready-to-use Javascripts, features a flexible Javascript PopUp Calendar, PopCal.

title: Bretteleben.de
desc: A small collection of free javascripts, created by the website-owner, mostly about image-presentation and image-manipulation, presented in german and english. The scripts are crossbrowser, one or two of them (one more way, rotating globe) unique at this time.

desc: Provides a clock using the WHATWG <canvas> element.

desc: Offers news, information, forum, and reviews.

desc: Illustrated tutorial about how the Sega Dreamcast video game console works, with information about how to compare and where to buy.

title: Planet Ring Myths and Legends
desc: A short look at the Planet Ring online software.

title: AutoIt

title: Interclasse
desc: Articles and examples. WSH, VBS, HTA and Python scripts.

title: Luban
desc: The component oriented simple scripting language with a robust component composition model.

title: mCL

title: MetaCollection
desc: A guide for webmasters and developers who are in search of CGI, Perl, or PHP script archives.

title: Nuclear Vision
desc: An HTML-style scripting language designed to be run on a web server but can also be run from the command line. By Shining Light Productions.

title: OnScript

title: Searching Algorithms
desc: Overview of many sorting techniques and corresponding links.

title: Sequential and Parallel Sorting Algorithms
desc: Description of sorting algorithms with examples

title: Sequitur
desc: A method for inferring compositional hierarchies from strings, useful for recognizing lexical structure in long sequences. Examples, source code, description, publications, and an on-line demonstration.

title: Sorting Algorithm
desc: From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia. Classification,  summaries of the popular sorting algorithms, links.

title: Sorting Algorithm Visualization Poster
desc: A poster visualizing and comparing 12 famous sorting algorithms showing their distinctive features.

title: Sorting Algorithms
desc: Overview of many sorting techniques and corresponding links.

desc: Applet visualizing various sorting algorithms, English version of Peter Weigel and Andreas Boltzmann applet.

title: Sorting and Searching Algorithms By Thomas Niemann.
desc: Collection of algorithms for sorting and searching from arrays to B-Trees - theory, examples, implementation.

title: String Searching With Suffix Trees
desc: Fast String Searching With Suffix Trees by Mark Nelson

title: comp.graphics.algorithms Frequently Asked Questions
desc: Basic computations frequently needed in graphics.

title: Fast Line Drawing Algorithms by Po-Han Lin
desc: Contains sources for graphical algorithms to draw lines.  Included are the  popular Bresenham algorithm, the Wu's Symmetric Double-Step, and the fastest non-cpu dependent algorithm, the Extremely Fast Line Algorithm (EFLA).

title: Graphics Gems Repository
desc: The official site for source code, errata, and addenda to the Graphics Gems book series.

desc: Several articles on real-time graphics rendering.

title: Hugues Hoppe's Homepage
desc: A collection of research graphics articles.

title: Inferno Project
desc: The research of Ray Tracing accelerated by modern Graphics Hardware (GPU).

title: M Spline
desc: A new linear best quality and fast algorithm of raster image scaling.

title: Map Projection
desc: Very basic grey page with some useful links on map projection.

title: Cerny
desc: Offers solutions for type checking, schema validation and dependency management.

title: CKeditor
desc: Web-based HTML text editor with powerful formatting capabilities. Requires no installation on the client computer.

title: ColorPop
desc: A pop-up color picker control for use on web pages.

title: Custom Form Elements with Javascript
desc: An open source library to enhance web-based XHTML forms in terms of style, usability and accessibility by using Javascript and CSS. It is based on various Javascript frameworks. Features, demo, download, how-tos, and inside information on the development team are presented,

title: DHTML Cross-Browser JavaScripts
desc: Vertical, horizontal and typewriter scrollers, and a collection of free Javascripts. Multi-OS and multi-browser compatible.

title: Email AntiLeech
desc: Prevents all software to grab email addresses from site.

title: ESPX  and TinyXSL
desc: ESPX, an ECMAScript Parser for (almost) XML, with namespaces; and TinyXSL, XML transform in-Script mini-Language

title: Flowplayer
desc: Minimalistic, yet full-featured HTML5/Flash video player.

title: Focus on JavaScript
desc: A bulk of scripts and other JavaScript resources.

title: Google: Closure
desc: Create powerful and efficient JavaScript.

title: Opscript

desc: Directory of free scripts and tools for ASP, PHP, JavaScript.

title: Scripting Language
desc: Growing article, with links to many related topics. [Wikipedia]

title: Scripts for Developers and Programmers
desc: Directory of free and paid scripts across all types of platforms. Fully searchable.

title: Scriptygoddess
desc: A weblog for people who don't know everything about scripts and stuff to learn from each other. ASP, PHP and Javascript related articles. CSS tricks.

title: SWIG (Simplified Wrapper and Interface Generator)

desc: Article describing and discussing the SoundEx searching algorithm and enhancements to make it more accurate.  Includes SoundEx conversion form and Open licensed source code in C, JavaScript, and Perl.

desc: Definition, classification, common algorithms, links.

title: Map Projection Overview

desc: Article by Diana Gruber on how to model sprite animation in a computer game.

title: Publications by Loic Barthe
desc: Comprehensive list of publications by L. Barthe on modelling from sketching, point based modelling, subdivision surfaces and implicit modelling.

title: HIOX Free Javascript Scripts

desc: Generates a well-formed XHTML string from an HTML DOM object. H2X could be used in Content Management Systems (CMS), online wysiwyg HTML editors or any other javascript application to produce well formed XHTML 1.0 code.

desc: Scripts for form validation, browser detection, cookies, images swaping. Also calculator and slider game.

title: Javascripting
desc: A collection of client-side libraries.

title: Magic Toolbox
desc: Provides an image zoom script in two different versions. [Commercial]

title: WinBatch

title: Real-time Optimally Adapting Meshes (ROAM)

Survey of applications of texture mapping including simple texture mapping, projective textures, and image warping; description of texture mapping techniques for drawing anti-aliased lines, air-brushes, and anti-aliased text; and show of how texture mapping may be used as a fundamental graphics primitive for volume rendering, environment mapping, color interpolation, and contouring.

title: Cluster

title: mmonteleone/DeLorean
desc: Flux capacitor for accurately faking time-bound JavaScript unit testing, including timeouts, intervals, and dates (setTimeout, setInterval, clearTimeout, clearInterval, or Date).

title: Mocha
desc: A test framework running on node.js and the browser which runs tests serially, mapping uncaught exceptions to the correct test cases.

title: Nightwatch.js
desc: Browser automated testing, JavaScript End-to-End tests in Node.js which run against a Selenium server.

title: occ/TraceKit
desc: Attempts to create stack traces for unhandled JavaScript exceptions in all major browsers.

desc: Uses cucumber.js with zombie.js for integration testing, mocha with should.js for unit testing on the server side, and jasmine with sinon for unit testing on the client side.

title: philbooth/spooks.js
desc: A small and simple library for creating unit test spies and mock objects in JavaScript.

title: Quail

desc: Short yet complete node.js programming examples.

title: Common Node

title: Cradle
